descript.abstract: The Horizon Fragments table lists the mineral and organic fragments that generally occur in the referenced horizon. If the Volume % is greater than zero (low=5, RV=10, high=15) in a row, the kind and size of fragment in that row exists everywhere this horizon and component occur in the map unit. If the Volume % includes zero (low=0, RV=5, high=10), the kind and size of fragment may exist in some places, but not in others.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

attr.attrdef: The lithology/composition of the 2 mm or larger fraction of the soil (20 mm or larger for wood fragments).
Size based on the multiaxial dimensions of the fragment fraction.
The volume percentage of the horizon occupied by the 2 mm or larger fraction (20 mm or larger for wood fragments), on a whole soil base.
The volume percentage of the horizon occupied by the 2 mm or larger fraction (20 mm or larger for wood fragments), on a whole soil base.
A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Horizon Fragments table.
The unique identifier of a record in the Horizon table. Use this column to join the Horizon Fragments table to the Horizon table.
An expression of the sharpness of edges and corners of fragments. (Sedimentary Rocks, Pettijohn, 1957)
Size based on the multiaxial dimensions of the fragment fraction.
Size based on the multiaxial dimensions of the fragment fraction.
The volume percentage of the horizon occupied by the 2 mm or larger fraction (20 mm or larger for wood fragments), on a whole soil base.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: A description of the overall shape of the fragment.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
